p: The 18 Arabidopsis accessions were inoculated with the 5 virus isolates as described above, with 10 replicates per treatment and accession. In these plants, virus multiplication, virulence, short-term seed survival, and efficiency of seed transmission were quantified as described below. Using these data, 6 out of the 18 Arabidopsis accessions were selected (An-1, Bay-0, Cad-0, Cum-0, Ll-0, and Fei-0) such that (i) accessions represented a range of TuMV and CMV seed transmissions ( Fig. 1) and (ii) accessions with different life cycles were included ( Table 1). We also selected one CMV isolate (Fny-CMV) and one TuMV isolate (JPN1-TuMV) for further experiments because they showed a wide range of percentages of seed transmission across accessions and were transmitted in a larger number of accessions.
